books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A classic novel depicting a totalitarian society and the struggle for individuality and truth.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A powerful story that addresses issues of race and injustice through the eyes of a young girl.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: An exploration of the American Dream and the excesses of the Jazz Age, set in the Roaring Twenties.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The first book in the beloved series following the journey of a young wizard and his friends at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic tale of love and social norms in early 19th-century England.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The enchanting prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins on his unexpected journey.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: A legendary story of Captain Ahab's obsession with the white whale, Moby-Dick.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
books.description: The tale of an orphaned governess and her journey to self-discovery, love, and independence.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story of teenage angst and rebellion, following Holden Caulfield in the days after being expelled from prep school.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian vision of a future society where advanced technology and social engineering have eliminated suffering, but at a profound cost.
